@Luke McCormick Further to your comments in the dev meeting, I tried implementing a dark mode for my admin theme Lumi (https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/lumi/issues/1) but had issues with icons throughout core not being visible on a dark background. So there's a potential blocker for any dark themes...

Add dark mode · Issue #1 · backdrop-contrib/lumi
Part of the reason I started this theme was to create a theme with a dark mode for Backdrop. However when I started styling the dark mode part, I realised that I'm not as much of a designer as ...
Interesting
It doesn't seem like front-end themes would suffer from that. There aren't any included icons needed, are there?
@Luke McCormick I just configured Basis to use custom dark colours on my sandbox site, and the first problem I notice is Drop in the footer is hidden on a dark background.
Also, if the front-end theme is also used for content editing, then there are icons like the autocomplete spinner that look ugly then.
And CKEditor is still stark white. Not sure if/how it's possible to make that dark too...

Not sure if/how it's possible to make that dark too...

It's possible to get a dark content edit area via hook_ckeditor_settings_alter() - with something like $settings['contentsCss'][] = $color_css;.
Here's an example (Lateral with the "Night" preset):
ckeditor-dark.png

It's also possible to change css files only via ckeditor_stylesheets[] = css/yourcss.css in your theme's info file.

I never tried to replace the CKEditor skin with Moono Dark. Has anyone done this before? Core only ships with moono-lisa.

Moono Dark
This theme is a dark version of Moono Skin which originally was designed and developed as a CKEditor skin contest entry. Features: black UI new icons I would like to thank Craig McLeod (Build.) for his support and keeping this project going.

There's now a module that provides additional CKEditor skins (work in progress). A dark one is included:

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/ckeditor_skins

backdrop-contrib/ckeditor_skins
Additonal CKEditor skins for Backdrop CMS. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/ckeditor_skins development by creating an account on GitHub.

Is this Backdrop's first dark mode-enabled theme...? https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/lumi

backdrop-contrib/lumi
A modern, customisable admin theme for Backdrop. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/lumi development by creating an account on GitHub.
I just updated Lumi to a new version that now includes dark mode support! :tada:
It's been a while in the making, and a learnt lots of (not-so-good) things about core in the process :smiling_face:
There's likely lots that can be improved, so have a play and open some issues.
Did you find that any core changes would be helpful?
So cool! :tada:
@docwilmot The main thing with core is the hard-coded icons - black PNGs. It'd be nice if they were more customisable (I.e. an icon font or SVGs).
@BWPanda Not sure I'd recommend it, but you could use CSS to invert the PNG to white: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/filter-function/invert()

@quicksketch Interesting... If it's a matter of me doing it specifically for the Lumi contrib theme though, then I'll just do what I did in other places (like the autocomplete spinner gif) and find/use FontAwesome icons instead. I just thought to mention it since any other dark-mode themes will have to fix this themselves too in future, so it'd be better if it were fixed in core once, rather than hacked in contrib multiple times :smiling_face:

...similar to the "there's a module for that" catch-phrase for Drupal, I would like to say "there's an issue for that": https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/364 :sweat_smile:

Add an icon font to core · Issue #364 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
We have a handful of icons in core that are currently images. We should replace these with an icon font instead. Up-sides of using an icon font in core: A complete set of matching core icons This l...
Just tried Lumi, and it looks awesome @BWPanda ++
bwpanda (Karma: 30)
...already filed 2 issues for it, but imma stop now ...don't wanna turn it into the same situation as the core queue :sweat_smile:
Here's n idea: different set of settings for the same theme, depending on whether it's being used as frontend or admin theme! ...so regular for frontend, whereas dark mode in admin pages.
